subject: Re: [junit] can anyone plz explain solution for this
msgSnippet: A stab in the dark: Are you using JUnit 4.x or 3.X? It seems that you are using the 3.x jars and there Test is not an annotation, it s a regular interface. If
messageBody:
A stab in the dark: Are you using JUnit 4.x or 3.X? It seems that you are
using the 3.x jars and there Test is not an annotation, it's a regular
interface.
If you switch to JUnit 4.x you also need to remove "extends TestCase"
(otherwise JUnit4 will try to be backwards compatible and look for methods
starting with "test" rather than methods annotated with @test).

I hope this brings you closer to the solution.
/J

On 10/30/06, dulani_udayangani <dulani_udayangani@...> wrote:
>
> I have problem in runnig this test case please advice.
> package junit.framework;
>
> import org.junit.*;
> import static org.junit.Assert.*;
>
> import java.util.*;
>
> public class TestTestCase extends TestCase {
> private Collection<Object> collection;
>
> @Before
> public void setUp() {
> collection = new ArrayList<Object>();
> }
>
> @Test
> public void testEmployeeCollection() {
> assertTrue (collection.isEmpty());
> }
> @Test
> public void testOneItemCollection() {
> collection.add("itemA");
> assertEquals(1,collection.size());
> }
> }
>
> error is -
> ""TestTestCase.java": incompatible types; found :
> junit.framework.Test, required: java.lang.annotation.Annotation at
> line 49, column 6"
>
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
